text:
The Surah is so designated after the first sentence.

Period of Revelation

Its subject matter so closely resembles that of Surah Ad-Duha that both these Surah seem to have been revealed in about the same period under similar conditions. According to Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas, it was sent down in Makkah just after wad-Duha.

Theme and Subject Matter

The aim and object of this Surah too is to console and encourage the Holy Messenger (upon whom be Allah's peace). Before his call he never had to encounter the conditions which he suddenly had to encounter after it when he embarked on his mission of inviting the people to Islam. This was by itself a great revolution in his own life of which he had no idea in his life before Prophethood. No sooner had he started preaching the message of Islam than the same society which had esteemed him with unique honor, turned hostile to him. The same relatives and friends, the same clansmen and neighbors, who used to treat him with the highest respect, began to shower him with abuse and invective. No one in Makkah was prepared to listen to him; he began to be ridiculed and mocked in the street and on the road; and at every step he had to face new difficulties. Although gradually he became accustomed to the hardships, even much severer ones, yet the initial stage was very discouraging for him.
That is why first Surah Ad-Duha was sent down to console him, and then this Surah.

In it, at the outset, Allah says: "We have favored you, O Prophet, with three great blessings; therefore you have no cause to be disheartened. The first is the blessing of Sharh Sadr (opening up of the breast), the second of removing from you the heavy burden that was weighing down your back before the call, and the third of exalting your renown the like of which has never been granted to any man before. Further below in the notes we have explained what is implied by each of these blessings and how great and unique these blessings indeed are!

After this, the Lord and Sustainer of the universe has reassured His Servant and Messenger (upon whom be peace) that the period of hardships which he is passing through, is not very long, but following close behind it there is also a period of ease. This same thing has been described in Surah Ad-Duha, saying: "Every later period is better for you than the former period, and soon your Lord will give you so much that you will be well pleased."

In conclusion, the Holy Prophet has been instructed, so as to say, "You can develop the power to bear and resist the hardships of the initial stage only by one means, and it is this: \`When you are free from your occupations, you should devote yourself to the labor and toil of worship, and turn all your attention exclusively to your Lord'."This same instruction has been given him in much greater detail in Surah Al-Muzzammil: 1-9.
description: The surah that opens with a reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad that his divine appointment to receive God’s revelation has been nothing less than the Opening of the breast to sacred wisdom and guidance, and that thereby he has been honoured for all time, made well-able to bear the mantle of prophethood, and that ultimately and inevitably he shall be eased unto success. It is named “opening” after the phrase “did We not open” (a lam nashraḥ) in verse 1. The surah is a continuation of the reassurance and encouragement given in the previous surah.The surah is also known as: Broadened Breast, Comfort, Consolation, Relief, The Expanding, The Expansion, The Opening Up, The Opening of The Heart, The Opening-Up of the Heart.

null.verse 94:1: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Məgər Biz (haqqı bilmək, elm və hikmət dəryası etmək üçün) sənin köksünü (qəlbini) açıb genişlətmədikmi?! (Allahın öz lütfü ilə köksünü açıb genişlətdiyi kimsənin qəlbinə Şeytan vəsvəsə sala bilməz. O, qüdsiyyət kəsb edər, vəhy qəbul etməyə layiq olar!)
null.verse 94:2: Ağır yükünü səndən götürmədikmi?! (Sənin peyğəmbərlik yükünü yüngülləşdirmədikmi?!)
null.verse 94:3: (Elə bir yük ki) sənin belini bükürdü.
null.verse 94:4: Sənin ad-sanını (şan-şöhrətini) ucaltmadıqmı?! (Yerdə, göydə səndən söhbət gedər; xütbələrdə adın çəkilər!)
null.verse 94:5: Şübhəsiz ki, hər çətinlikdən sonra bir asanlıq gələr! (Asanlıq yalnız çətinliklə hasil olar!)
null.verse 94:6: Həqiqətən, hər çətinlikdən sonra bir asanlıq gələr! (Buna görə də çətinliklərə səbirlə dözmək lazımdır!)
null.verse 94:7: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Elə ki (risaləti təbliğ etməkdən və ya dünya işlərindən) azad oldun, qalx (dua et)! (Axirət üçün çalış-vuruş!)
null.verse 94:8: Və ancaq Rəbbinə yalvar! (Uzünü Allaha çevirib yalnız Onun köməyinə bel bağla, Ona tərəf yönəl !)

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 94:1: Have We not expanded thee thy breast?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 94:2: And removed from thee thy burden
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 94:3: The which did gall thy back?-

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 94:1: Did We not expand thy breast for thee

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 94:3: the burden that weighed down thy back?

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 94:7: So when thou art empty, labour,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 94:8: and let thy Lord be thy Quest.

Muhammad Asad.verse 94:1: HAVE WE NOT opened up thy heart,
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:2: and lifted from thee the burden
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:3: that had weighed so heavily on thy back?
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:4: And [have We not] raised thee high in dignity?
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:5: And, behold, with every hardship comes ease:
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:6: verily, with every hardship comes ease!
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:7: Hence, when thou art freed [from distress], remain steadfast,
Muhammad Asad.verse 94:8: and unto thy Sustainer turn with love.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 94:2: And We removed from you your burden

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 94:8: and towards your Lord turn with eagerness.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:1: Have We not broadened your breast for you (for the light of knowledge, wisdom and spiritual gnosis)?

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:3: (The load) which was growing heavier on your (holy) back.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:4: And We exalted for you your remembrance (by annexing it to Ours everywhere in the world and in the Hereafter).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:5: So surely ease (comes) with every hardship.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:6: Verily, with (this) hardship (too) there is ease.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:7: So when you are free (from educating the Umma (Community), preaching the Din (Religion) and fighting, and fulfilling your responsibilities), then strive hard (in remembrance and the worship of your Lord),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 94:8: And turn to your Lord earnestly.

George Grigore, Coranul.verse 94:1: Nu ţi-am deschis Noi oare pieptul?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 94:4: N-am înălţat Noi oare amintirea ta?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 94:8: şi către Domnul tău căută cu dor!

null.verse 94:1: Мы разве не раскрыли грудь твою?
null.verse 94:2: С души твоей не сняли бремя,
null.verse 94:4: И не возвысили ту честь, к которойты приставлен?
null.verse 94:5: Ведь, истинно,За каждой тягостью наступитоблегченье.
null.verse 94:6: Поистине,За каждой тягостью настанетоблегченье.
null.verse 94:7: И вот когда покончишь (с тяготойв молитве),Трудиться продолжай и дальше
null.verse 94:8: И все усилия Владыке своему направь.

null.verse 94:1: ¿No te hemos infundido ánimo,
null.verse 94:2: Liberado de la carga
null.verse 94:4: Y alzado tu reputación?
null.verse 94:5: ¡La adversidad y la felicidad van a una!
null.verse 94:6: ¡La adversidad y la felicidad van a una!
null.verse 94:7: Cuando estés libre, ¡mantente diligente!
null.verse 94:8: Y a tu Señor ¡deséale ardientemente!

null.verse 94:1: நாம், உம் இதயத்தை உமக்காக விரிவாக்கவில்லையா?
null.verse 94:2: மேலும், நாம் உம்மை விட்டும் உம் சுமையை இறக்கினோம்.
null.verse 94:4: மேலும், நாம் உமக்காக உம்முடைய புகழை மேலோங்கச் செய்தோம்.
null.verse 94:5: ஆதலின் நிச்சயமாகத் துன்பத்துடன் இன்பம் இருக்கிறது.
null.verse 94:6: நிச்சயமாக துன்பத்துடன் இன்பம் இருக்கிறது.
null.verse 94:7: எனவே, (வேலைகளிலிருந்து) நீர் ஓய்ந்ததும் (இறைவழியிலும், வணக்கத்திலும்) முயல்வீராக.
null.verse 94:8: மேலும், முழு மனத்துடன் உம் இறைவன் பால் சார்ந்து விடுவீராக.

null.verse 94:1: เรามิได้เปิดหัวอกของเจ้าแก่เจ้าดอกหรือ ?
null.verse 94:2: และเราได้ปลดเปลื้องภาระหนักของเจ้าออกจากเจ้าแล้ว
null.verse 94:3: ซึ่งเป็นภาระหนักอึ้งบนหลังของเจ้า
null.verse 94:4: และเราได้ยกย่องให้แก่เจ้าแล้ว ซึ่งการกล่าวถึงเจ้า
null.verse 94:5: ฉะนั้นแท้จริงหลังจากความยากลำบากก็จะมีความง่าย
null.verse 94:6: แท้จริงหลังจากความยากลำบากก็จะมีความง่าย
null.verse 94:7: ดังนั้นเมื่อเจ้าเสร็จสิ้น (จากงานหนึ่งแล้ว) ก็จงลำบากต่อไป
null.verse 94:8: และยังพระเจ้าของเจ้าเท่านั้นก็จงมุ่งปรารถนาเถิด

null.verse 94:1: Biz senin göğsünü açıp genişletmedik mi?
null.verse 94:2: Yükünü senden alıp atmadık mı?
null.verse 94:4: Senin şânını ve ününü yüceltmedik mi?
null.verse 94:5: Elbette zorluğun yanında bir kolaylık vardır.
null.verse 94:6: Gerçekten, zorlukla beraber bir kolaylık daha vardır.
null.verse 94:7: Boş kaldın mı hemen (başka) işe koyul,
null.verse 94:8: Yalnız Rabbine yönel.

null.verse 94:1: Сенинг кўксингни кенг қилиб қўймадикми?
null.verse 94:2: Ва сенинг юкингни енгиллатмадикми?
null.verse 94:3: У сенинг елкангни босиб турган эди.
null.verse 94:4: Ва сенинг зикрингни юқори кўтардик.
null.verse 94:5: Бас, албатта, бир қийинчилик билан осончилик бордир.
null.verse 94:6: Албатта, бир қийинчилик билан осончилик бордир.
null.verse 94:7: Фориғ бўлсанг, ибодатига урингин.
null.verse 94:8: Ва фақат Роббингга рағбат қил.
